snippet: Everyday Food will be cut from 10 issues a year to five and will no longer be sold as a stand-alone publication.
abstract: Everyday Food will be cut from 10 issues a year to five and will no longer be sold as a stand-alone publication.
lead_paragraph: Everyday Food, the middle-market cooking digest published by Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia, will be cut from 10 issues a year to five and will no longer be sold as a stand-alone publication. The company also announced plans to scale back Whole Living magazine. About 70 employees will be laid off, or 12 percent of the nearly 600-person company. Read more on Media Decoder »

headline.main: Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia Scales Back Food Magazine
